Package ss.pentago.network.client

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • ss.pentago.network.client.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OfflineClient, OnlineClient
    public abstract class Client
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The Client maintains a list of listeners to update whenever something noteworthy happens. It also has an InputHandler to obtain user input and which tells the Client what to do.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected Game currentGame
      The Game that this Client is currently playing, null if no game is being played right now.
      protected InputHandler inputHandler
      The Client receives commands from the InputHandler, which deals with user input (e.g.
      protected java.util.List<ClientListener> listeners
      The Client forwards output (like messages, game states) to its listeners, who could do anything with it.

      Create a new Client.

    • Field Detail

      • listeners

        protected final java.util.List<ClientListener> listeners
        The Client forwards output (like messages, game states) to its listeners, who could do anything with it.

      • inputHandler

        protected InputHandler inputHandler
        The Client receives commands from the InputHandler, which deals with user input (e.g. through reading from System.in).

      • currentGame

        protected Game currentGame
        The Game that this Client is currently playing, null if no game is being played right now.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        protected Client()
        Create a new Client. The player parameter is used for the username, and to be able to request hints (in case of a HumanPlayer), or be able to call AI moves (in case of an AIPlayer).

        After creating a new instance of Client, the intended use is to call addListener(ClientListener) and setInputHandler(InputHandler).

    • Method Detail

      • inform

        public void inform​(java.lang.String message)
        Inform this Client to notify its listeners with the message.
        Parameters:
        message - the message

      • informError

        public void informError​(java.lang.String error)
        Inform this Client to notify its listeners with the error message.
        Parameters:
        error - the error message

      • informBoard

        public void informBoard​(Board board)
        Inform this Client to notify its listeners about the board state.
        Parameters:
        board - the board

      • informMove

        public void informMove​(Player p,
                       Move move)
        Inform this Client to notify its listeners about a move.
        Parameters:
        p - the player who made the move, leave null for only displaying the move
        move - the move

      • setInputHandler

        public void setInputHandler​(InputHandler inputHandler)
        Sets the InputHandler associated with this Client. The InputHandler forwards user input to this Client.
        Parameters:
        inputHandler - the inputhandler

      • addListener

        public void addListener​(ClientListener listener)
        Subscribe a new ClientListener to this Client.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener​(ClientListener listener)
        Unsubscribe the ClientListener from this Client.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to remove

      • getMove

        public abstract Move getMove()
        If this Client has a HumanPlayer, this function can be used to return a "hint". If this Client has an AIPlayer, this can be used to return the move the AI would make.
        Returns:
        null when not in a game, the move otherwise

      • updateGame

        public abstract void updateGame​(Move move)
        Update the game and inform the listeners of the board change.
        Parameters:
        move - the move to update the game with

      • getCurrentGame

        public Game getCurrentGame()
        Returns:
        the game that is currently being played, null if no game is played right now

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts this Client in a new thread.

      • close

        public void close()
        Perform a clean up when this Client shuts down. By default this clears the ClientListeners associated with this Client, and sets the game to null.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        This should be called after this Client has exited the main run loop. This method will call close() and stop the InputHandler thread.
